items.description: The Essex coast from Clacton to and including, St Peters Flat and the Colne and Blackwater estuaries
items.message: This message has been issued because some minor flooding to coastal roads and footpaths is likely between 2:15pm and 4:15pm today, Wednesday 14th September. Tides are expected to be higher than usual due to the forecast weather conditions during spring tides. Clacton Promenade, Lee-over-Sands and Brightlingsea seafront may see some wave overtopping and spray. The Strood at Mersea Island, Coast Road and car parks on the front at West Mersea, and the Hythe and Promenade at Maldon may be flooded. The detailed forecast for those that use it is for a peak level at Clacton of 2.82mAODN at 3:15pm on Wednesday 14th September, which is 0.22m above tide tables, wind force 3, north-easterly. (mAODN is height above average sea level, for more information refer to local tide tables). Take care on coastal roads and footpaths, and don't put yourself in unnecessary danger. We are monitoring the situation and not expecting the situation to escalate. We will update this message by 5:30pm today, Wednesday 14th September.

items.description: Wye Estuary in Gloucestershire
items.message: his Flood Alert has been removed.  Tides are now receding following the period of high spring tides and as a result there is no longer a risk of flooding in the area.  We will continue to monitor the forecast and re-issue this alert if necessary. Please continue to remain careful along promenades, coastal footpaths and roads.

items.description: Tidal Thames riverside from Putney Bridge to Teddington Weir
items.eaAreaName: Kent, South London and East Sussex

floodArea.county: Greater London, Hammersmith and Fulham, Hounslow, Richmond upon Thames, Wandsworth

items.message:
River levels are expected to be high as a result of spring tides.

The forecast high tide at Richmond is 4.65mAOD at 18:15 on 14/09/22.

Flooding of low-lying roads and footpaths is expected, which may exist for one to two hours either side of high tide. Flooding of properties is not expected.

We believe there is a possibility of flooding for Putney Embankment (SW15), Chiswick Mall and Strand on the Green (W4), Thames Bank at Mortlake (SW14), Ranelagh Drive (TW1), Friars Lane and Water Lane (TW9), Riverside and The Embankment at Twickenham, and the Towpath below Teddington Lock. 

Astronomical tide levels are falling. The river flow at Teddington Weir is low for this time of year at 6 cubic metres per second and is steady. We anticipate the flows to remain low for the next few days.

We are closely monitoring the situation.

This message will be updated by 20:00 on 14/09/22, or as the situation changes.

items.description: The north Norfolk coast from Old Hunstanton, to and including Cley
items.message: This message has been issued because some minor flooding to coastal roads and footpaths is likely between 8:30am and 10:30am tomorrow morning, Wednesday 14th September. Tides are expected to be higher than usual due to the forecast weather conditions during spring tides. We expect to see water on roads and paths to beaches and on the quays in Brancaster, Burnham Overy, Holkham, Wells and Blakeney. The detailed forecast for those that use it is for a peak level at Wells of 3.58mAODN at 9:30am on Wednesday 14th September, which is 0.26m above tide tables, wind force 2, northerly. (mAODN is height above average sea level, for more information refer to local tide tables). You are advised to stay away from at risk areas and take care next to the coast. We are monitoring the situation and not expecting the situation to escalate. We will update this message by midday tomorrow, Wednesday 14th September.

items.description: The north Norfolk coast from East Cley to Kelling Hard, including Salthouse
items.message: This message has been issued because some minor flooding to coastal roads and footpaths is likely between 8:30am and 10:30am tomorrow morning, Wednesday 14th September. Tides are expected to be higher than usual due to the forecast weather conditions during spring tides. We may see water on Beach Road at Cley and Beach Road at Salthouse, and footpaths in the marshes may also become inaccessible. The detailed forecast for those that use it is for a peak level at Wells of 3.58mAODN at 9:30am on Wednesday 14th September, which is 0.26m above tide tables, wind force 2, northerly. (mAODN is height above average sea level, for more information refer to local tide tables). Take care on coastal roads and footpaths, and don't put yourself in unnecessary danger. We are monitoring the situation and not expecting the situation to escalate. We will update this message by midday tomorrow, Wednesday 14th September.

items.description: Somerset coast at Porlock Weir
items.message:
The Flood Alert for this area has now been removed. 
Coastal conditions should ease for the tides over the coming days. 
We continue to monitor the situation. Please be careful along beaches, promenades, coastal footpaths and roads.
Please see the GOV.UK website for a 5 day flood forecast.

items.description: Eastern Yar
items.message: The water level in the Eastern Yar is high and rising.  In the last 12 hours, 36 mm of rain was recorded at Knighton. From 10:00 today (14/9/22), water levels will become noticeably high at Alverstone, rising near to the top of the river bank.  Some minor out of bank flooding may also occur in fields at Langbridge. We do not expect access issues to Horringford or impacts at Sandown. Property flooding is not expected.  Further rain is expected this morning and water levels will rise throughout this time, being generally much higher than normal. Rain is expected to clear the area this afternoon.  At Alverstone, the river wonâ€™t peak until at least 13:00 this afternoon, by which time levels will be very high, right to the top of the river bank, near the main road bridge. Drier weather this afternoon and tomorrow (15/9/22) will give water levels a chance to recover.  We continue to monitor the forecast and respond to any reported blockages.  Please ensure that pumps used to protect gardens and property can operate.  This Flood Alert will be updated at 16:00 on 14/09/2022.
